sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_2:
To calculate the determinant of a 3x3 matrix, we can use the following formula:

det(A) = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg)

where a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, and i are the elements of the matrix:

\begin{bmatrix} 
a & b & c \\
d & e & f \\
g & h & i \\
\end{bmatrix}

In this case, the matrix is:

\begin{bmatrix} 
1 & 2 & 3 \\
4 & 5 & 6 \\
7 & 8 & 9 \\
\end{bmatrix}

So, the determinant is:

det(A) = 1(5*9 - 6*8) - 2(4*9 - 6*7) + 3(4*8 - 5*7)

det(A) = 1(45 - 48) - 2(36 - 42) + 3(32 - 35)

det(A) = 1(-3) - 2(-6) + 3(-3)

det(A) = -3 + 12 - 9

det(A) = 0

So, the determinant of the given matrix is 0.
